outcome_details: The respondent's motion was granted, resulting in the eviction of the applicant from the Condo, along with the requirement to pay occupation rent.
decision_factors: No written agreement for life tenancy
Condo passed by survivorship, not part of estate
Financial incapability of respondent to maintain rent-free usage
cited_cases: Brisco Estate v. Canadian Premier Life Insurance Company, 2012 ONCA 854
Dagarsho Holdings Ltd. v. Bluestone, 2004 CanLII 11271
summary: The court ruled in favor of the respondent, requiring the applicant to vacate the condo by February 28, 2025, and to pay an occupation rent of $2,200 per month starting July 1, 2024.
